<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class MatrixReader {
```java
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        List<String[]> rows = new ArrayList<String[]>();
        try {
            BufferedReader bfr = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("matrix.txt"));
            String line;
            while ((line = bfr.readLine()) != null) {
                String[] row = line.split(" ");
                rows.add(row);
            }
            bfr.close();
            for (String[] row : rows) {
                for (String element : row) {
                    int index = element.indexOf("-");
                    int replacementIndex = Integer.parseInt(element.substring(index + 1));
                    element = element.replaceFirst("-", Integer.toString(replacementIndex));
                }
                System.out.println(Arrays.toString(row));
            }
        } catch (IOException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
```
}

<<<explanation>>>: The code provided reads the matrix from a text file and splits each line into an array of strings. The loop then iterates through each element in each row, finds the index of the replacement element, and replaces it with the corresponding replacement index. Finally, the modified matrix is printed to the console.
